action.action-desc: Mr. Reed (for himself and Mr. Durbin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Direct Loan Program under the Higher Education Act of 1965 to provide for student loan affordability, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responsible Student Loan Solutions Act .

subsection.header: Terms and conditions of federal direct loans
subsection.text: Section 455 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 ( 20 U.S.C. 1087e ) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Federal Direct Stafford Loan limits for new loans on or after July 1, 2013

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, with respect to Federal Direct Stafford Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the aggregate unpaid principal amount for all such loans made on or after such date (and including Federal Direct Stafford Loans first disbursed before such date) to any student shall not at any time exceed—

clause.text: $31,000, in the case of any dependent student (except an undergraduate dependent student whose parents are unable to borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program) who has not successfully completed a program of undergraduate education; or

$57,500, in the case of any independent student, or an undergraduate dependent student whose parents are unable to borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program, who has not successfully completed a program of undergraduate education.

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, with respect to Federal Direct Stafford Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the maximum annual amount for all such loans made on or after such date a student who has not successfully completed a program of undergraduate education may borrow in any academic year shall not at any time exceed—

clause.text: in the case of a dependent student (except an undergraduate dependent student whose parents are unable to borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program)—

subclause.text: who has successfully completed such first year but has not successfully completed the remainder of a program of undergraduate education, $6,500; and
who has successfully completed the first and second years of a program of undergraduate education but has not successfully completed the remainder of such program, $7,500; and

clause.text: in the case of an independent student, or an undergraduate dependent student whose parents are unable to borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program—

subclause.text: who has successfully completed such first year but has not successfully completed the remainder of a program of undergraduate education, $10,500; and
who has successfully completed the first and second years of a program of undergraduate education but has not successfully completed the remainder of such program, $12,500.

paragraph.header: Interest rates for new loans on or after July 1, 2013

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding the preceding paragraphs of this subsection, for—

clause.text: Federal Direct Stafford Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the applicable rate of interest shall, during any 12-month period beginning on July 1 and ending on June 30, be determined on the preceding June 1 and be equal to—

subclause.text: the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to such June 1; plus

clause.continuation-text: except that such rate shall not exceed 6.8 percent; and

clause.text: Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the applicable rate of interest shall, during any 12-month period beginning on July 1 and ending on June 30, be determined on the preceding June 1 and be equal to—

subclause.text: the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to such June 1; plus

clause.continuation-text: except that such rate shall not exceed 8.25 percent.

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding the preceding paragraphs of this subsection, for Federal Direct PLUS Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the applicable rate of interest shall, during any 12-month period beginning on July 1 and ending on June 30, be determined on the preceding June 1 and be equal to—

clause.text: the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to such June 1; plus

subparagraph.continuation-text: except that such rate shall not exceed 8.25 percent.

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding the preceding paragraphs of this subsection, for Federal Direct Consolidation Loans for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the applicable rate of interest shall, during any 12-month period beginning on July 1 and ending on June 30, be determined on the preceding June 1 and be equal to—

clause.text: the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to such June 1; plus

subparagraph.continuation-text: except that such rate shall not exceed 8.25 percent.

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in the flush text under clauses (i) and (ii) of subparagraph (A), subparagraph (B), and subparagraph (C), during each 12-month period beginning on July 1 and ending on June 30, beginning on July 1, 2013, the Secretary shall determine a percentage for application under clauses (i)(II) and (ii)(II) of subparagraph (A), subparagraph (B)(ii), and subparagraph (C)(ii). In carrying out this subparagraph, the Secretary may determine different percentages for application under each such clause or subparagraph, as long as such percentages in the aggregate—

clause.text: represent the total cost of administering the Federal Direct Loan program and borrower benefits; and
result in such program being revenue neutral for such 12-month period.

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Reduction of fee for Federal Direct PLUS Loans
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), for any Federal Direct PLUS Loan for which the first disbursement is made on or after July 1, 2013, the Secretary shall charge the borrower of the Loan an origination fee of not more than 3 percent of the principal amount of the loan.

subsection.text: Part D of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 ( 20 U.S.C. 1087a et seq. ) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary may reissue a Federal Direct PLUS Loan for which the first disbursement was made before July 1, 2013, that is not in default in order to permit the borrower to obtain the interest rate provided under section 455(b)(8)(B).
The Secretary may purchase a Federal PLUS Loan that is not in default and reissue such loan in order to permit the borrower to obtain the interest rate provided under section 455(b)(8)(B).

The Secretary may charge a borrower an amount not to exceed 0.5 percent of the principal amount of the loan to be reissued or purchased to cover the administrative cost of reissuing or purchasing such loan, which amount shall be paid to the Secretary.

The Secretary may reissue a Federal Direct Stafford Loan or a Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loan for which the first disbursement was made before July 1, 2013, that is not in default in order to permit the borrower to obtain the interest rate provided under section 455(b)(8)(A).

The Secretary may purchase a Federal Stafford Loan or a Federal Unsubsidized Stafford Loan that is not in default and reissue such loan in order to permit the borrower to obtain the interest rate provided under section 455(b)(8)(A).

The Secretary may charge a borrower an amount not to exceed 0.5 percent of the principal amount of the loan to be reissued or purchased to cover the administrative cost of reissuing or purchasing such loan, which amount shall be paid to the Secretary.
